pullRequest.body:
Define the evaluation of (Mv)PowerSeries in complete hausdorff linear algebras

Co-authored-by: Mar√≠a In√©s de Frutos Fern√°ndez

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1168|1|erw|

Current commit [3f22b9008c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3f22b9008c5fef936eb1eaf223d6299237c01397)
Reference commit [549995156c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/549995156cb106d81107d1494802ed5c994e4b6e)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Note: the import linter makes a wrong recommendation here:
```
Warning: ././././Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Evaluation.lean:8:1: warning: import #[Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic] instead
././././Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Evaluation.lean:
  remove #[Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Topology]
  add #[Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic]
```
but #[Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Topology] is necessary to access `WithPiTopology`.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14990~~

What's the overlap between this PR and #20424 (cc @erdOne)?

:v: AntoineChambert-Loir can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> What's the overlap between this PR and #20424 (cc @erdOne)?

I didn't notice the other PR, thanks for spotting this! @AntoineChambert-Loir @mariainesdff can you please wait before merging this one? Thanks!

I am holding off that PR because this PR should have a better approach. I'll see how to recreate that PR with these results after the series of PRs are merged, and then determine if we still want them.
OK, so I guess this is ready to go.

Thanks!

Le 17 mars 2025 15:43:43 GMT+01:00, Riccardo Brasca ***@***.***> a √©crit¬†:
>@riccardobrasca commented on this pull request.
>
>Thanks!
>
>bors d+
>
>> @@ -327,6 +327,8 @@
>   "Mathlib.Tactic.ArithMult": ["Mathlib.Tactic.ArithMult.Init"],
>   "Mathlib.Tactic.Algebraize": ["Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Tower"],
>   "Mathlib.RingTheory.SimpleModule.Basic": ["Mathlib.Data.Matrix.Mul"],
>+  "Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Evaluation":
>
>What is the problem with these files?
>
>> @@ -125,6 +125,13 @@ theorem add {a b : R} (ha : IsTopologicallyNilpotent a) (hb : IsTopologicallyNil
>     IsTopologicallyNilpotent (a + b) :=
>   ha.add_of_commute hb (Commute.all ..)
> 
>+/-- The topological nilradical of a ring with a linear topology -/
>+def topologicalNilradical : Ideal R where
>
>Can you add at least the obvious `...mem_iff` lemma?
>
>> +    IsUniformInducing (coeToMvPowerSeries.ringHom (œÉ := œÉ) (R := R)) :=
>+  (isUniformInducing_iff ‚áëcoeToMvPowerSeries.ringHom).mpr rfl
>+
>+theorem _root_.MvPolynomial.coeToMvPowerSeries_isDenseInducing :
>+    IsDenseInducing (coeToMvPowerSeries.ringHom (œÉ := œÉ) (R := R)) :=
>+  coeToMvPowerSeries_isUniformInducing.isDenseInducing coeToMvPowerSeries_denseRange
>+
>+variable {a : œÉ ‚Üí S}
>+
>+/- The evaluation map on multivariate polynomials is uniformly continuous
>+for the uniform structure induced by that on multivariate power series. -/
>+theorem _root_.MvPolynomial.coeToMvPowerSeries_uniformContinuous
>+    [UniformAddGroup R] [UniformAddGroup S] [IsLinearTopology S S]
>+    (hœÜ : Continuous œÜ) (ha : HasEval a) :
>+    UniformContinuous (MvPolynomial.eval‚ÇÇHom œÜ a) := by
>+  classical
>
>```suggestion
>```
>
>> +theorem eval‚ÇÇ_C (r : R) :
>+    eval‚ÇÇ œÜ a (C œÉ R r) = œÜ r := by
>
>```suggestion
>theorem eval‚ÇÇ_C (r : R) : eval‚ÇÇ œÜ a (C œÉ R r) = œÜ r := by
>```
>If you want. Same below.
>
>> +
>+theorem eval‚ÇÇHom_eq_extend (hœÜ : Continuous œÜ) (ha : HasEval a) (f : MvPowerSeries œÉ R) :
>+    eval‚ÇÇHom hœÜ ha f =
>+      coeToMvPowerSeries_isDenseInducing.extend (MvPolynomial.eval‚ÇÇ œÜ a) f :=
>+  rfl
>+
>+theorem coe_eval‚ÇÇHom (hœÜ : Continuous œÜ) (ha : HasEval a) :
>+    ‚áë(eval‚ÇÇHom hœÜ ha) = eval‚ÇÇ œÜ a := by
>+  ext f
>+  simp only [eval‚ÇÇHom_eq_extend, eval‚ÇÇ]
>+  split_ifs with h
>+  ¬∑ obtain ‚ü®p, rfl‚ü© := h
>+    simpa [MvPolynomial.coe_eval‚ÇÇHom, coeToMvPowerSeries.ringHom_apply] using
>+      coeToMvPowerSeries_isDenseInducing.extend_eq
>+        (coeToMvPowerSeries_uniformContinuous hœÜ ha).continuous p
>+  ¬∑ rfl
>
>```suggestion
>  ¬∑ rw [‚Üê eval‚ÇÇHom_eq_extend hœÜ ha]
>```
>
>> +    rw [‚Üê MvPolynomial.coe_eval‚ÇÇHom, ‚Üê comp_apply, MvPolynomial.comp_eval‚ÇÇHom]
>+    rfl
>
>```suggestion
>    rw [‚Üê MvPolynomial.coe_eval‚ÇÇHom, ‚Üê comp_apply, MvPolynomial.comp_eval‚ÇÇHom,  
>      MvPolynomial.coe_eval‚ÇÇHom]
>```
>
>> +  ¬∑ exact Continuous.comp hŒµ (continuous_eval‚ÇÇ hœÜ ha)
>+  ¬∑ intro p
>+    simp only [Function.comp_apply, eval‚ÇÇ_coe]
>+    exact Polynomial.hom_eval‚ÇÇ p œÜ Œµ a
>+  ¬∑ simp only [RingHom.coe_comp, Continuous.comp hŒµ hœÜ]
>+
>+variable [Algebra R S] [ContinuousSMul R S]
>+
>+/-- For `IsTopologicallyNilpotent a`,
>+the evaluation homomorphism at `a` on `PowerSeries`, as an `AlgHom`. -/
>+noncomputable def aeval (ha : IsTopologicallyNilpotent a) :
>+    PowerSeries R ‚Üí‚Çê[R] S :=
>+  MvPowerSeries.aeval (hasEval ha)
>+
>+theorem coe_aeval (ha : IsTopologicallyNilpotent a) :
>+    ‚áë(aeval ha) = eval‚ÇÇ (algebraMap R S) a :=
>
>```suggestion
>    ‚Üë(aeval ha) = eval‚ÇÇ (algebraMap R S) a :=
>```
>Let's Lean figure out what coercion is needed here.
>
>> +    PowerSeries R ‚Üí‚Çê[R] S :=
>+  MvPowerSeries.aeval (hasEval ha)
>+
>+theorem coe_aeval (ha : IsTopologicallyNilpotent a) :
>+    ‚áë(aeval ha) = eval‚ÇÇ (algebraMap R S) a :=
>+  MvPowerSeries.coe_aeval (hasEval ha)
>+
>+theorem continuous_aeval (ha : IsTopologicallyNilpotent a) :
>+    Continuous (aeval ha : PowerSeries R ‚Üí S) :=
>+  MvPowerSeries.continuous_aeval (hasEval ha)
>+
>+theorem aeval_coe (ha : IsTopologicallyNilpotent a) (p : Polynomial R) :
>+    aeval ha (p : PowerSeries R) = Polynomial.aeval a p := by
>+  rw [coe_aeval, Polynomial.aeval_def, eval‚ÇÇ_coe]
>+
>+theorem aeval_unique {Œµ : PowerSeries R ‚Üí‚Çê[R] S} (hŒµ : Continuous Œµ) :
>
>(symmetric version of) This can be `simp`.
>
